page.title: 07TOURISM (1)
page.content: The{Cotswolds,}situated between{Oxford and{Stratford,}has great appeal for tourists. The Tourist Information Centre housed in the Library in the Square receives up to 50 enquiries per day at the height of the holiday season. Most enquiries are for {accommodation,}particularly Bed and Breakfast. Many local householders take advantage of the tourist trade by using their spare rooms for this purpose. There are, of course, plenty of{hotels}providing full board within the D-block. One is part of the Crest chain of hotels (the Unicorn), but most are privately owned or are part of a brewery's chain of public houses that also offer accommodation. Several of the hotels began life as{coaching {inns}when Stow was on several coach routes before the Railway Age dawned.
